“Music is the universal language of mankind”


Like any language, music can be written by following a set of rules. Musical pitches are represented by notes and notes are represented with English letters.

The letters A, B, C, D, E, F, G are used for musical notes.
One of the most popular instruments is the piano. A full piano has 88 keys which each corresponds to a specific note. A piano can play really low notes and really high notes.

We write notes on a staff. The staff is like lined paper for musical writing.
Lines and spaces can contain a note.
Really high notes can also be written above the staff and low notes can be written below the staff.
Putting multiple notes on a staff is how music is written!

pages.tip: These are in alphabetical order-remember where A is.
